_header: What meanest thou hope dost thou me scoff and scorne
Title(s): ‘For who that absent is is woobigon’
_description:
Charles d’Orléans, ‘For who that absent is is woobigon’, translated from the French (Champollion-Figeac (1842)
XChampollion-Figeac, Aime. Les Poesies du duc Charles d’Orleans. Paris, 1842, 106) — three 9-line stanzas (ababbcdcd) and 6-line Envoy

BLHar682.First Lines: What menyst þou hope dost þou me skoffe & skorneFor wordis moche thou hast and flateryng…
BLHar682.Last Lines:
…That y myght knowe the fyne of my distresFor who that absent
                    is is woo bigoon
